options.text: Give an initial intravenous bolus injection of 20 % lipid emulsion 1.5 mL/kg over 1 min.

questions.correct_answer: D. It has minimal effects on wound healing.

questions.correct_answer: A. They are variable-pressure, variable-orifice devices

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: A mutation on chromosome 3 is responsible

options.label: C
options.text: Abnormal ryanodine receptors prevent calcium release into the cytoplasm

options.label: D
options.text: Dantrolene should be kept ready while performing this case

questions.correct_answer: D. Dantrolene should be kept ready while performing this case

questions.text: Regarding the bispectral index (BIS):

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Higher values represent more cortical activity

questions.text: When you try to give an unresponsive adult a rescue breath and the chest does not appear to rise, what would you do next?

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat the head tilt/chin lift maneuver and attempt the breath again

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat the head tilt/chin lift maneuver and attempt the breath again

questions.text: A 41-year-old man has been induced for a laparoscopic cholecystectomy with fentanyl 100 mcg, propofol 200 mg, and atracurium 40 mg. On direct laryngoscopy it is not possible to pass the back of the tongue and no epiglottis is seen. The patient is oxygenated with 100 % oxygen, repositioned, and a further attempt at direct laryngoscopy is made with no improvement in the view. What is the next management strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: One further attempt at direct laryngoscopy with a McCoy blade laryngoscope.

options.label: B
options.text: One further attempt at direct laryngoscopy with a bougie.

options.label: C
options.text: Abandon further direct laryngoscopy and insert a laryngeal mask airway.

options.label: D
options.text: Abandon further direct laryngoscopy and establish an airway with an emergency cannula cricothyroidotomy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Abandon further direct laryngoscopy and insert a laryngeal mask airway.

questions.text: Rocuronium:

options.label: A
options.text: Is predominantly excreted in the urine

options.label: B
options.text: Can raise arterial blood pressure and heart rate

options.label: D
options.text: Will usually provide intubating conditions within 30 s

questions.correct_answer: B. Can raise arterial blood pressure and heart rate

questions.correct_answer: A. Ketamine is a phencyclidine derivative.

questions.text: Metabolism of local anaesthetics depends on chemical structure.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Ester local anaesthetics are rapidly metabolized in cerebrospinal fluid

questions.correct_answer: D. Metabolites from ester hydrolysis are excreted in the urine

questions.text: Atracurium:

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: C. Is less associated with bronchospasm than rapacuronium

questions.text: Drugs safe to use in porphyria include all except:
Soda lime absorbs carbon dioxide in an exothermic reaction and is utilized in many breathing circuits. Which of the following regarding this process are true?

options.label: A
options.text: Soda lime is capable of absorbing up to 50 litres of carbon dioxide per 100 g

options.label: B
options.text: Colour change is an indicator of soda lime exhaustion

options.label: C
options.text: Intermittent use allows soda lime to ‘regenerate’

options.label: D
options.text: Soda lime dust is harmless and, when inhaled, it is simply exhaled again

questions.correct_answer: B. Colour change is an indicator of soda lime exhaustion

questions.text: Concerning Suxamethonium all are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is formed by combining two acetylcholine molecules

options.label: B
options.text: It is a trigger for malignant hyperpyrexia

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with myasthenia gravis are likely to require a reduced dose of suxamethonium

questions.correct_answer: D. Patients with myasthenia gravis are likely to require a reduced dose of suxamethonium

questions.text: A 29-year-old male undergoes a rapid sequence induction to secure his airway for emergency trauma surgery to fix multiple limb fractures following a serious motorcycle accident. He is very cold and venous access was very difficult in A&E. As the thiopentone is injected into his left hand, the patient cries out in pain and his arm becomes suddenly very pale and cyanosed. What is the most suitable analgesic method to control this situation?
Which statement best describes the correct mechanism of action of the following antiemetics?

options.label: A
options.text: Dexamethasone has been shown to downregulate 5-HT 3 receptors.

options.label: B
options.text: Ondansetron is a 5HT3 receptor antagonist acting in the chemoreceptor trigger zone.

options.label: C
options.text: Droperidol causes cholinergic blockade and post-synaptic GABA antagonism.

options.label: D
options.text: Metoclopramide acts as an anti emetic via 5HT 3 receptors centrally and peripherally.

questions.correct_answer: B. Ondansetron is a 5HT3 receptor antagonist acting in the chemoreceptor trigger zone.

questions.text: During an elective orthopaedic operating list a patient is scheduled to have an achilles tendon repair for which the patient has to be placed in the prone position. Complications directly from prone positioning include:

During an elective orthopaedic operating list a patient is scheduled to have an achilles tendon repair for which the patient has to be placed in the prone position. Complications directly from prone positioning include:
Regarding sugammadex:

options.label: A
options.text: It is a specific reversal agent for rocuronium only

options.label: B
options.text: It is a modified tertiary amine

options.label: C
options.text: It can reverse profound neuromuscular blockade from rocuronium

options.label: D
options.text: Its use is associated with histamine release.

questions.correct_answer: C. It can reverse profound neuromuscular blockade from rocuronium

questions.text: Concerning minimum alveolar concentration (MAC) all are true except?

options.label: C
options.text: It is defined as a percentage at 1 atmosphere

options.label: D
options.text: The MAC of nitrous oxide is higher than that of halothane

questions.correct_answer: A. MAC is decreased in hyperthyroidism

questions.text: Local anaesthetics are available in various strengths and preparations:

options.label: A
options.text: Glucose is added to bupivacaine to make hypobaric solution.

options.label: B
options.text: The preservative methyl paraben is often added as a preservative

options.label: C
options.text: The addition of bicarbonate reduces the amount of the unionized form of the local anaesthetic

options.label: D
options.text: Lidocaine and amethocaine are mixed in equal parts to form a eutectic mixture of local anaesthetic cream

questions.correct_answer: B. The preservative methyl paraben is often added as a preservative

questions.text: The following are true of the Mapleson E and F breathing systems:

options.label: A
options.text: The type F system is a modified type E system

options.label: B
options.text: Controlled ventilation is not possible with a type E system

options.label: C
options.text: They are used mainly for adult anaesthesia due to their high resistance

options.label: D
options.text: A flow rate of 1.5 times minute ventilation is considered adequate for spontaneous ventilation

questions.correct_answer: A. The type F system is a modified type E system

questions.text: All of the following are proven benefits of epidural analgesia except:

An 10-year-old boy has presented to A&E with severe lower abdominal pain and his left testicle looks ischaemic. He is booked urgently into the emergency theatre for surgical exploration. He is normally fit and well with no anaesthetic issues in the family. He had breakfast 3 hours ago. What would be the appropriate method to anaesthetize him?

options.label: A
options.text: General anaesthesia with laryngeal mask airway.

options.label: B
options.text: General anaesthesia and secure the airway with uncuff ed tube.

options.label: C
options.text: General anaesthesia and secure the airway with cuff tube.

options.label: D
options.text: Rapid sequence induction with thiopental and suxamethonium.

questions.correct_answer: D. Rapid sequence induction with thiopental and suxamethonium.

questions.text: Clinical signs of adequate return of neuromuscular function following non-depolarizing neuromuscular blockade includes:

options.label: A
options.text: Sustained head lift for at least 3 seconds

options.label: B
options.text: Generation of a vital capacity breath of at least 4 ml.kg–1

options.label: C
options.text: Generation of a negative inspiratory pressure of -40cms of water

options.label: D
options.text: Tidal volume adequate to maintain oxygen saturation above 96%

questions.correct_answer: C. Generation of a negative inspiratory pressure of -40cms of water

questions.text: The following agents are examples of racemic mixtures except
Concerning sevoflurane:

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Compound A, produced from sevoflurane’s reaction with moist soda lime, is nephrotoxic in humans

questions.text: Concerning the Mapleson A breathing systems:

options.label: A
options.text: If it is used for controlled ventilation at a flow rate is kept at 2 times the minute ventilation

options.label: B
options.text: The coaxial version of this system is known as a Bain circuit

options.label: C
options.text: It is most commonly used mapleson circuit

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most efficient of the Mapleson classified circuits for spontaneous ventilation

questions.correct_answer: D. It is the most efficient of the Mapleson classified circuits for spontaneous ventilation

questions.text: The following drugs are predominantly metabolized by the liver:
When operating an AED, what are the correct steps to follow?

options.label: A
options.text: Power on the AED, attach electrode pads, shock the individual, and analyze the rhythm

options.label: B
options.text: Power on the AED, attach electode pads, analyze the rhythm, clear the individual, and deliver shock

options.label: C
options.text: Attach electrode pads, check pulse, shock individual, and analyze rhythm

options.label: D
options.text: Check pulse, attach electrode pads, analyze rhythm, shock patient

questions.correct_answer: B. Power on the AED, attach electode pads, analyze the rhythm, clear the individual, and deliver shock

questions.text: You have given an interscalene block for a patient undergoing shoulder surgery. However, about 30 min after the block, the patient finds that his voice is getting hoarse and he is finding it difficult to speak. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
Concerning total intravenous anaesthesia all are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: No adjunctive analgesia is required in anaesthesia if propofol is being used

options.label: B
options.text: A dedicated cannula for anaesthesia is mandatory

options.label: C
options.text: It is indicated in patients with a history of malignant hyperpyrexia

options.label: D
options.text: Cannot measure the level of drugs intraoperatively.

questions.correct_answer: A. No adjunctive analgesia is required in anaesthesia if propofol is being used

questions.text: What are the vital characteristics of first-rate CPR?

options.label: A
options.text: Starting chest compressions within 10 seconds of recognition of cardiac arrest

questions.text: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a recognized treatment modality in cases of severe or medication-resistant depression. Regarding ECT:

options.label: A
options.text: Methohexitone is the agent of choice for induction

options.label: B
options.text: Propofol is the preferred induction agent as it allows the longest seizure duration

options.label: C
options.text: Etomidate is contraindicated as an induction agent as it raises the seizure threshold

options.label: D
options.text: Use of scoline is contraindicated for use in ECT.

questions.correct_answer: A. Methohexitone is the agent of choice for induction

questions.text: How many breaths should be given during a two-rescuer CPR on an adult with an advanced airway in place?

options.label: A
options.text: Every 2 to 3 seconds (20 to 30 breaths per minute)

options.label: B
options.text: Every 4 to 5 seconds (12 to 15 breaths per minute)

options.label: C
options.text: Every 6 to 8 seconds (8 to 10 breaths per minute)

options.label: D
options.text: Every 10 to 12 seconds (5 to 6 breaths per minute)

questions.correct_answer: C. Every 6 to 8 seconds (8 to 10 breaths per minute)

questions.text: A 42-year-old male is on the list for an acute appendicectomy. Preassessment reveals a history of myasthenia gravis (MG). The following statements regarding MG are true

options.label: A
options.text: In the performance of a rapid sequence induction the dose of suxamethonium remains unchanged

options.label: B
options.text: The underlying pathophysiology is decreased release of acetylcholine from the presynaptic nerve terminal

options.label: C
options.text: There is increased sensitivity to non depolarizing muscle relaxant.

options.label: D
options.text: Neuromuscular monitoring will demonstrate improved post-tetanic count following tetanic stimulation

questions.correct_answer: C. There is increased sensitivity to non depolarizing muscle relaxant.

questions.text: Sedation with which of the following drugs is most likely to resemble normal sleep?

While dining out in a restaurant you hear a mother cry out that her six-month-old child, who was given some marbles by an older child, is gagging. His mouth area is turning blue and he’s unable to take a breath or cry out. What would you do first in this scenario?

options.label: C
options.text: Deliver back blows and chest thrusts

questions.correct_answer: C. Deliver back blows and chest thrusts

questions.text: Regarding pulse oximeters:

options.label: A
options.text: They are reliable even in the situation of shock.

options.label: B
options.text: They tend to give falsely low readings in patients with carbon monoxide toxicity

options.label: C
options.text: They are useful as they provide an indication of the adequacy of a patient’s minute ventilation

options.label: D
options.text: Deoxyhaemoglobin absorbs more red light than oxyhaemoglobin

questions.correct_answer: D. Deoxyhaemoglobin absorbs more red light than oxyhaemoglobin

questions.text: Which of the following muscle relaxants is eliminated the most by renal excretion?
Which of the following intravenous anesthetics is converted from a water-soluble to a lipid-soluble drug after exposure to the bloodstream?

A 25-year-old primipara has an accidental dural tap (ADT) with a 16-G tuohy needle while the anaesthetist was attempting labour epidural analgesia. A day after the ADT, the patient is complaining of severe positional frontal and occipital headache. Which of the following is not appropriate for management?
Which of the following drugs is capable of crossing the blood-brain barrier?
Intrathecal fentanyl is useful for postoperative analgesia after caesarean section, but which of the following is the most common side effect of using it?
You have a 3-year-old child listed for tonsillectomy. The following are true regarding the paediatric airway:

options.label: A
options.text: The larynx is situated more anteriorly and caudad than adults.

options.label: B
options.text: The epiglottis is large and U-shaped

options.label: C
options.text: The airway is widest at the cricoid ring

options.label: D
options.text: Because of unique anatomy, paediatric patients need to be intubated with a cuffed endotracheal tube

questions.correct_answer: B. The epiglottis is large and U-shaped

questions.text: The most common reason for patients to rate anesthesia with etomidate as unsatisfactory is:
Which of the following volatile anesthetics is unique in containing preservative?
Postanesthetic shivering can be treated with all of the following EXCEPT
Concerning inhalational anaesthetic potency:

options.label: A
options.text: There is inverse proportionality between oil:gas partition coefficients and potency

options.label: B
options.text: MAC is directly proportional to potency

options.label: C
options.text: Halothane is more potent than sevoflurane

options.label: D
options.text: Desflurane’s quick onset and offset is a reflection of its low potency

questions.correct_answer: C. Halothane is more potent than sevoflurane

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with a history of COPD undergoes left shoulder arthroscopic surgery under interscalene brachial plexus block. The operation was uneventful. In recovery after 30 min the nurse looking after the patient noticed he was looking pale, with heart rate of 110, BP of 110/70 mmHg, respiratory rate of 25/min, and saturation of 90 % on room air. On auscultation there was no wheeze and air entry on left base was reduced. The chest X-ray in recovery appears normal. What is the most likely cause of his symptoms?
Concerning halothane: false statement is:

options.label: D
options.text: It increases myocardial sensitivity to catecholamines

questions.correct_answer: C. It is irritant to breathe

questions.text: Laryngeal mask airway (LMA) is now used more commonly then endotracheal tube while providing general anaesthesia worldwide. Which of the following statements regarding its use is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: There is low incidence of aspiration when LMA is used in full-stomach patients.

options.label: B
options.text: The LMA tip fits the laryngeal inlet but does not seal it completely.

options.label: C
options.text: It can be safely used in cardiopulmonary resuscitation as an alternative to endotracheal tube.

options.label: D
options.text: LMA is difficult to insert as compared to an endotracheal tube.

questions.correct_answer: C. It can be safely used in cardiopulmonary resuscitation as an alternative to endotracheal tube.

questions.text: The highest trace concentration of N2O allowed in the operating room (OR) atmosphere by the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) is
Central neuraxial blockade is contraindicated in all of the following except:

options.label: B
options.text: Regular aspirin administration 75 mg once daily

options.label: C
options.text: Regular clopidogrel administration 75 mg once daily

options.label: D
options.text: Warfarin stopped 3 days ago, INR 1.7 on day of surgery

questions.correct_answer: B. Regular aspirin administration 75 mg once daily

questions.text: A sevoflurane vaporizer will deliver an accurate concentration of an unknown volatile anesthetic if the latter shares which property with sevoflurane?
Glycopyrrolate:

options.label: A
options.text: Is a more potent antisialogogue than atropine

options.label: B
options.text: Is completely unionized at physiological pH

options.label: C
options.text: Is associated with amnesia, confusion and excitation in elderly patients

questions.correct_answer: A. Is a more potent antisialogogue than atropine

questions.text: Duration of anaesthesia will have following effects on the MAC of inhalational agent?

options.label: D
options.text: Acute administration increases MAC; chronic administration decreases MAC

options.label: B
options.text: The patient is pre-oxygenated for 3 minutes before the procedure

options.label: C

questions.text: Which of the following would result in the greatest decrease in the arterial hemoglobin saturation (Spo2) value measured by the dual-wavelength pulse oximeter?

questions.text: A 40-year-old chronic smoker was scheduled for cholecystectomy under general anesthesia. options.text: Entry into the right sided bronchus

questions.text: What is the ratio of chest compressions and breaths when a lone person is giving cardiopulmonary resuscitation?

options.label: A
options.text: With the heel of one hand and the other hand on top of the first

options.label: B
options.text: With the heel of one hand only

options.label: D
options.text: With the thumb of one hand.

questions.correct_answer: C. With 2 fingers of one hand

questions.text: How should chest compressions be performed on an infant?

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.text: During external chest compression (ECC) at 100/min, cardiac output is increased by the following:

options.label: C
options.text: Changing rescuers performing ECC every 2 min

options.label: D
options.text: Ensuring complete chest wall relaxation by removing hands from the chest wall between compressions.

questions.correct_answer: D. Ensuring complete chest wall relaxation by removing hands from the chest wall between compressions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a correct statement regarding paediatric cardiac arrest:

options.label: A
options.text: Is most commonly from hypoxia-related causes rather than primary cardiac pathology

options.label: B
options.text: Presents with VF in approximately 80% of out-of-hospital cases

options.label: C
options.text: In hospital, most commonly is caused by respiratory pathology.

options.label: D
options.text: Can be accurately diagnosed by healthcare professionals using a pulse check

questions.correct_answer: A. Is most commonly from hypoxia-related causes rather than primary cardiac pathology
